metadata.Title: CVE-2019-16884 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
runc through 1.0.0-rc8, as used in Docker through 19.03.2-ce and other products, allows AppArmor restriction bypass because libcontainer/rootfs_linux.go incorrectly checks mount targets, and thus a malicious Docker image can mount over a /proc directory. It was discovered that runC incorrectly implemented AppArmor restrictions. An attacker could possibly use this issue to mount malicious images.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-16884` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

runc - 1.0.0~rc10-0ubuntu1~18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: runc package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.0~rc10-0ubuntu1~18.04.2').
